title: 838th Air Division
text:
The 838th Air Division is an inactive <a href="United%20States%20Air%20Force">United States Air Force</a> organization. Its last assignment was with <a href="Tactical%20Air%20Command">Tactical Air Command</a>, assigned to <a href="Twelfth%20Air%20Force">Twelfth Air Force</a> at <a href="Forbes%20Air%20Force%20Base">Forbes Air Force Base</a>, Kansas. It was inactivated on 24 December 1969.
The <a href="Air%20Division%20%28United%20States%29">division</a> was first activated in the fall of 1957 at <a href="Ardmore%20Air%20Force%20Base">Ardmore Air Force Base</a>, where the <a href="463d%20Troop%20Carrier%20Wing">463d Troop Carrier Wing</a> and <a href="419th%20Troop%20Carrier%20Group">419th Troop Carrier Group</a> were stationed. However, the 419th, which was flying <a href="Fairchild%20C-123%20Provider">Fairchild C-123 Provider</a>s, was inactivated in December, rather than upgrading to a <a href="wing%20%28military%20aviation%20unit%29">wing</a> and the 838th was inactivated along with it.
History.
Ardmore Air Force Base.
The 838th Air Division was first activated on 25 September 1957 at <a href="Ardmore%20Air%20Force%20Base">Ardmore Air Force Base</a>, Oklahoma in anticipation that the <a href="419th%20Troop%20Carrier%20Group">419th Troop Carrier Group</a> would be expanded to a wing, joining the <a href="463d%20Troop%20Carrier%20Wing">463d Troop Carrier Wing</a> at Ardmore. The <a href="Air%20Division%20%28United%20States%29">division</a>'s 838th Air Base Group assumed the management of the base from the 463d Air Base Group, which was inactivated upon transferring its resources. However, the 463d Wing was converting from the <a href="Fairchild%20C-123%20Provider">Fairchild C-123 Provider</a> to become the Air Force's first <a href="Lockheed%20C-130%20Hercules">Lockheed C-130 Hercules</a> wing and it was decided to inactivate the 419th and its Providers before the end of the year, along with the new division. The division commander, Col James L. Daniel Jr., had been the commander of the 463d wing before the division was activated and returned to that command when the division and 419th Group were inactivated on 11 December 1957. The 838th Air Base Group was reassigned to the 463d Wing and remained the base host unit.
Pope and Forbes Air Force Bases.
The division was reactivated at <a href="Pope%20Air%20Force%20Base">Pope Air Force Base</a> in July 1963 and was assigned the <a href="464th%20Troop%20Carrier%20Wing">464th Troop Carrier Wing</a>, a C-123 wing stationed there. In October the 463d Troop Carrier Wing, which had recently moved to <a href="Langley%20Air%20Force%20Base">Langley Air Force Base</a>, Virginia was again assigned to the 838th. Both wings performed worldwide tactical airlift and participated in tactical <a href="military%20exercise">exercises</a> and operations. Its 463d Wing supported forces deploying in response to the <a href="Gulf%20of%20Tonkin%20incident">Gulf of Tonkin incident</a> in Operation One Buck beginning shortly after the incident in August 1964. The 464th Wing conducted combat crew training until April 1964 and kept two of its squadrons deployed overseas for most of the period it was assigned. It was awarded the <a href="MacKay%20Trophy">MacKay Trophy</a> in 1964 for <a href="Operation%20Dragon%20Rouge">Operation Dragon Rouge</a>, the <a href="humanitarian%20aid">humanitarian</a> airlift of over 1500 <a href="refugee">refugee</a>s from the <a href="Republic%20of%20the%20Congo">Republic of the Congo</a> in an operation that continued after it was reassigned to another division. It also received an <a href="Air%20Force%20Outstanding%20Unit%20Award">Air Force Outstanding Unit Award</a> for the actions of its elements deployed to Vietnam performing combat airlift missions. The 464th had sent two squadrons of Providers to South Vietnam during 1962 in <a href="Operation%20Mule%20Train">Operation Mule Train</a> and <a href="Operation%20Ranch%20Hand">Operation Ranch Hand</a>. The crews and planes operated as provisional units there. These planes were joined by a third squadron in 1963, although all were eventually transferred to regular <a href="Pacific%20Air%20Forces">Pacific Air Forces</a> units of the <a href="315th%20Troop%20Carrier%20Group">315th Troop Carrier Group</a>.
In November 1964, the division moved from Pope to <a href="Forbes%20Air%20Force%20Base">Forbes Air Force Base</a>, Kansas. The 463d and 464th Wings were relieved from assignment to the division and the <a href="313th%20Troop%20Carrier%20Wing">313th Troop Carrier Wing</a> at Forbes and the <a href="516th%20Troop%20Carrier%20Wing">516th Troop Carrier Wing</a> at <a href="Dyess%20Air%20Force%20Base">Dyess Air Force Base</a>, Texas were transferred to the 838th's command Until the division inactivated its wings frequently deployed aircraft and personnel to <a href="Europe">Europe</a>, the <a href="Far%20East">Far East</a>, and the <a href="Panama%20Canal%20Zone">Panama Canal Zone</a>.
In August 1969, the 516th Wing began training aircrews on the <a href="De%20Haviland%20Canada%20C-7%20Caribou">De Haviland Canada C-7 Caribou</a>. The 838th was inactivated in December 1969 and its units were reassigned directly to <a href="Twelfth%20Air%20Force">Twelfth Air Force</a>.
